etymology.interpretation: The character 茲(zī, "now") is historically interchangeable with 玆, serving as variant forms of one another and used in different contexts to represent the same concepts.

examples.chinese: 茲是改革的良机(茲是改革的良機)。
examples.pinyin: zī shì gǎi gé de liáng jī
examples.english: Now is the opportunity for reform.

examples.chinese: 时间不早(時間不早)，茲当出发(茲當出發)。
examples.pinyin: shí jiān bù zǎo, zī dāng chū fā
examples.english: It is late, now it is time to set off.
